sen.j: 乾 和信（いぬい かずのぶ、天文 (元号)13年（1544年） - 天正13年11月29日 (旧暦)（1586年1月18日））は、安土桃山時代後期の武士。
sen.e: Kazunobu (和信) INUI (1544 - January 18, 1586) was samurai of the late Azuchi-Momoyama period.
Kazunobu (和信) INUI (1544 - January 18, 1586) was samurai of the late Azuchi-Momoyama period.

sen.j: 山内一豊の臣。
sen.e: He was a retainer of Katsutoyo YAMAUCHI.
sen.cmt: 用語検索で「一豊」の読みは"Katsutoyo"と"Kazutoyo"がありましたが、前者をとって訳出しました。
sen.e: He was a retainer to Katsutoyo YAMAUCHI.
sen.cmt: to の方がいいと思います。
sen.e: He was a retainer to Katsutoyo YAMAUCHI.

sen.j: のち山内姓を賜い山内彦作と名乗る。
sen.e: He was conferred the surname YAMAUCHI and called himself Hikosaku YAMAUCHI.
He was conferred the surname YAMAUCHI and changed his name to Hikosaku YAMAUCHI.
sen.cmt: この方がわかり易いと思います。
sen.e: He was conferred the surname YAMAUCHI and changed his name to Hikosaku YAMAUCHI.

sen.j: 家禄は1300石。
sen.e: He received Karoku (hereditary stipend) of 1300 koku.
His Karoku (hereditary stipend) was worth 1300 koku.
sen.cmt: この方が自然だと思います。
sen.e: His Karoku (hereditary stipend) was worth 1300 koku.

sen.j: 妻は山内一豊の養女（実は安東郷氏の娘）。
sen.e: His wife was Katsutoyo YAMAUCHI's adopted daughter (Satouji ANDO's real daughter).
His wife was Katsutoyo YAMAUCHI's adopted daughter (Satouji ANDO's real daughter).
His wife was Katsutoyo YAMAUCHI's adopted daughter (Satouji ANDO's real daughter).

sen.j: 家紋は「丸之内桔梗」。
sen.e: His Kamon (family crest) was 'Chinese bellflower with circle.'
His Kamon (family crest) was 'The Chinese bellflower with a circle.'
sen.cmt: この方が文法的にあってると思います。
sen.e: His Kamon (family crest) was 'The Chinese bellflower with a circle.'

sen.j: 乾和三の兄。
sen.e: He was Kazumitsu INUI's older brother.
He was Kazumitsu INUI's older brother.

sen.j: 乾和宣の嫡子として美濃国に生まれる。
sen.e: He was born in Mino Province as a legitimate son on Kazunobu (和宣) INUI.
He was born in Mino Province as a legitimate heir of Kazunobu (和宣) INUI.
sen.cmt: legitimate heir の方が自然。あとonではなくof.
sen.e: He was born in Mino Province as a legitimate heir of Kazunobu (和宣) INUI.

sen.j: 和信は「一豊公前々（天正6年以前）より御存知に遊され」とあり、山内一豊が天正6年（1578年）播磨国三木城主別所長治攻めの際に初めて正式に召抱えられたとある。
sen.e: It was written that Kazunobu (和信) 'had long been known by Lord Katsutoyo (since before 1578)' and he was first formally employed in 1578 when Katsutoyo YAMAUCHI attacked Nagaharu BESSHO, a lord of Miki-jo Castle in Harima Province.

It was recorded that Kazunobu (和信) 'had long been known by Lord Katsutoyo (since before 1578),' and was formally employed in 1578 when Katsutoyo YAMAUCHI launched an attack against Nagaharu BESSHO, a lord of Miki-jo Castle in Harima Province.
sen.cmt: 直訳せずfirstをはぶきました。あとlaunched an attack の方がいいと思います。
sen.e: It was recorded that Kazunobu (和信) 'had long been known by Lord Katsutoyo (since before 1578),' and was formally employed in 1578 when Katsutoyo YAMAUCHI launched an attack against Nagaharu BESSHO, a lord of Miki-jo Castle in Harima Province.

sen.j: この合戦で軍功を立てたが負傷しため、気遣った一豊が着ていた紙製の陣羽織を脱いで和信に与えたという。
sen.e: Although he distinguished himself in this battle, he was wounded; Katsutoyo took off his paper Jinbaori (sleeveless campaign jacket worn over armor) and gave it to Kazunobu (和信) out of concern for him.
Although he distinguished himself in this battle, he was wounded; Katsutoyo took off his paper Jinbaori (sleeveless campaign jacket worn over armor) and gave it to Kazunobu (和信) out of concern.
sen.cmt: Of him と最後に書かなくてもわかります。
sen.e: Although he distinguished himself in this battle, he was wounded; Katsutoyo took off his paper Jinbaori (sleeveless campaign jacket worn over armor) and gave it to Kazunobu (和信) out of concern.

sen.j: その後も一豊に重用され、一豊の養女（実は安東郷氏の娘で、山内一豊の姪にあたる）を妻に賜い、山内姓の使用を許された。
sen.e: Since then he had been appointed to a position of trust by Katsutoyo and he married Katsutoyo's adopted daughter (Satouji ANDO'S real daughter and Katsutoyo YAMAUCHI'S niece) with permission to use the surname YAMAUCHI.

Afterwards, he continued to gain Katsutoyo's trust, and married Katsutoyo's adopted daughter (Satouji ANDO's biological daughter, and Katsutoyo's niece) with permission to use the family name YAMAGUCHI.

Afterwards, he continued to gain Katsutoyo's trust, and married Katsutoyo's adopted daughter (Satouji ANDO's biological daughter, and Katsutoyo's niece) with permission to use the family name YAMAGUCHI.

sen.j: 天正13年（1585年）一豊が近江国長浜に転封となると、知行1300石を与えられ家老となった。
sen.e: When Katsutoyo's territory was changed to Nagahama, Omi Province in 1585, he was given a fief of 1,300 koku and became Karo (chief retainer).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: When Katsutoyo's command was reassigned to the territory of Nagahama, Omi Province in 1585, he was given a fief of 1,300 koku and became the Karo (chief retainer).

sen.j: しかし、同年11月に起きた天正大地震の時、一豊の娘与祢を助けようとして、夫婦ともに死亡した。
sen.e: However, at the time of Tensho great earthquake in November of the same year, he and his wife died together trying to save Yone, Katsutoyo's daughter.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, at the time of Tensho great earthquake in November of the same year, he and his wife died together, while trying to save Yone, Katsutoyo's daughter.
sen.cmt: comma と while を入れたほうが文章が区切れがいいと思います。
sen.e: However, at the time of Tensho great earthquake in November of the same year, he and his wife died together, while trying to save Yone, Katsutoyo's daughter.

sen.j: 享年42。
sen.e: Died at the age of 42.

sen.j: 乾氏は清和源氏美濃土岐氏の支流。
sen.e: The Inui family was a branch of the Toki family of Mino Province, one of Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan).

sen.j: 土岐頼貞の四男道謙の子孫、土岐久右衛門重頼が、美濃国池田郡東野村を本拠とし、土岐氏の居城である稲葉山城の北西（乾）の方角であったため名字としたという。
sen.e: The origin of the surname is that Shigeyori hisaemon TOKI, a descendant of Yorisada TOKI's forth son Doken, was based in Higashino village, Ikeda County, Mino Province; in the northwest (inui) of Inabayama Castle: the castle where the Toki family usually resided.

sen.j: 和信には二子がいたが、父母殉死の際幼少のため、見性院 (山内一豊室)に養育された。
sen.e: Although Kazunobu (和信) had two children, they were brought up by Kenshoin (Katsutoyo YAMAUCHI's lawful wife) because they were very young when their parents sacrificed themselves, so that the family estate was inherited by his younger brother Kazumitsu INUI.

sen.j: 和信には二子は、一豊から偏諱「一（かつ）」の字を賜った。
sen.e: Kazunobu (和信) was granted Henki (granting subordinates the use of a character from the superior's real name) by Katsutoyo (一豊) with the letter '一 (pronounced "Katsu")' for his two children, however, he was too awed to use the letter '一' and named his sons Katsumasu (勝益) and Katsuji (勝次) with the letter '勝 (pronounced "Katsu")' instead, which has the same pronunciation.
sen.cmt: 「勝益」「勝次」それぞれに文字目の読み方は不明ですが、'Katsumasu' 'Katsuji' としました。
sen.e: Kazunobu (和信) was granted Henki (granting subordinates the use of a character from the superior's real name) by Katsutoyo (一豊) with the letter '一 (pronounced "Katsu")' for his two children.
